explanation: Agent A is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 requires a for statement to have at most one loop counter and for the third clause to modify only that loop counter. In the code the for loops use len as the loop counter (tested in the second clause) but the third clauses also modify dest and ptr (e.g. dest += sizeof(int), ptr += sizeof(int), len -= sizeof(int) and later dest++, ptr++, len--). That means more than one object is modified in the iteration-expression and the third clause does not modify only the loop counter — a clear violation of Rule 14.2.
